title: behemo_barisol
body:
A character of the [[Evillious Nendaiki]]. He is the "twin brother" of [[Levia barisol]], and is one of the protagonists of [[Barisol no Kodomo wa Hitorikko (vocaloid)|]].

One of the for pillar gods and the reason for the appearance of most of the [[Kagamine Len|Len]] characters through the series. He was a lonely boy who often was ostracized for his [[crossdressing]] habits and fascination for girl's stuffs.

Disciple of [[Held Yggdra]], he eventually researched about the body of the creatures and developed a method for creating humans.

[spoiler]Originally from the First Period, he had a connection to the developers behind the Second Period virtual world and had his original avatar, Levia, be a woman. After being contacted by Levia during the events of Barisol no Kodomo wa Hitorikko, he created another male avatar in the Second Period and claimed to be Levia's twin. His original body was responsible for bringing the refugees from the ruined Second Period out of the virtual world and into the ruined First Period upon which the Third Period was constructed. He is the true Master of the Heavenly Yard.

After the events of [[Kiseki no Yukue (vocaloid)|]], he reincarnated into the body of [[Elluka Chirclatia]] alongside Levia, remaining dormant inside her. After the Battle of Merrigod Plateau which resulted in the creation of [[Ma (evillious nendaiki)|]], he was blasted into the Hellish Yard, from which he travelled to the Heavenly Yard.

After reincarnating [[Allen Avadonia]] as [[Kokutan-douji]], he is ordered by [[Sickle (evillious nendaiki)|]] to bring the Irregular back to the Heavenly Yard, leading him to take up the identity of [[Tsukimoto Bufuko]] while in Jakoku.[/spoiler]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: irina_clockworker
body:
A main character and major antagonist from the [[Evillious Nendaiki]]. Portrayed by [[Nekomura Iroha]].

[spoiler]Her original identity was [[Maria Moonlit]], the puppet queen of Levianta. Her soul would then be moved into the body of a ghoul child (a type of artificial human) by [[Seth Twiright]].[/spoiler]

A Leviant citizen and the younger adoptive sister of [[Kiril Clockworker]]. She was a powerful witch and a major candidate in the [i]'MA' Project[/i]. [spoiler]During the project she killed the other 3 candidates, including her future sister-in-law, [[Elluka Chirclatia]].[/spoiler]

After almost dying during the Levianta's Catastrophe, her soul was transplanted into a mechanical stuffed red [[cat]] by [[Seth Twiright]] for save her life and from then she dedicated to wreack havoc and spread malice upon the world, while assuming different identities trough the ages, including [[I.R. (venomania-kou no kyouki)|]], [[AB-CIR]], [[Abyss I.R.]], and [[Julia Abelard]].

[spoiler]She later becomes one of the three souls fused together to create [[Ma (evillious nendaiki)|]], along with [[Levia barisol]] and [[Eve Moonlit]]. She would then be expelled into the [[Clockworker's Doll]], taking on the identity of [[Houtei no Nushi]].[/spoiler]

She's one of the main characters of [[Ma Survival (vocaloid)|]] and the focus of [[Dokoka de Kiita Uta (vocaloid)|]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]
other_names: イリーナ=クロックワーカー

title: elluka_clockworker
body:
A main character from the [[Evillious Nendaiki]]. Portrayed by [[Megurine Luka]].

After the destruction of her country as a result of her disastrous resurrection granting her immortality, [[Elluka Chirclatia]] took the surname of her [[Kiril Clockworker|fiance]]. At the request of her old friend, the deity [[Held Yggdra|Held]], she took the mission of gathering the [[Vessel of Sin|vessels of sin]] in an attempt to prevent the danger they posed to the world and as a way to cope with her pointless eternal life.

She later takes on [[Michaela (evillious nendaiki)|]] and [[Gumillia]] as apprentices.

[spoiler]Actually a reincarnation of [[Levia barisol]], using the body and identity of the deceased Elluka Chirclatia.[/spoiler]

She's the main character of [[Chrono Story (vocaloid)|]] and [[Ano Hashi ni Chikatte (Vocaloid)|]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]
other_names: エルルカ=クロックワーカー

title: ma_(evillious_nendaiki)
body:
Character from the [[Evillious Nendaiki]] and [spoiler]final antagonist of the series[/spoiler]. Her name is pronounced as the two individual letters, "em ay" (エムエー). Portrayed by [[Megurine Luka]], but generally shouldn't be tagged as such due to the different character designs.

A powerful sorceress and penwoman, apparently from Jakoku. Close friend and mistress of [[Gallerian Marlon]]. [[Chaban Capriccio (vocaloid)|]] states that her true name is [[Sudou Kayo|Kayo Sudou]].

[spoiler]An existence born from the soul fusion of [[Levia barisol]] ([[Elluka Clockworker]]), [[Irina Clockworker]] and [[Eve Moonlit]] after the Battle of Merrigod. With the only common thread between the three women being their candidacy for [[Ma Keikaku (vocaloid)|]] during [[Genzai Monogatari]], she chose to name herself Ma.

Lacking a soul of her own, she manipulated several people, including [[Sudou Kayo]] and Gallerian, to gather the [[vessel of sin|vessels of sin]], so she could fulfill her wish of became whole as a "pure being". She also attempted to expel the souls of the three women from her body as part of this, with her experiments on [[Lilith Baldured]] ending in failure due to her already being [[Riliane Lucifen d'Autriche|the reincarnation of an irregular]]. She would later have a child with [[Gandalf Marlon]] in a second attempt, but this was likewise a failure due to the child [[Gallerian Marlon|Gallerian]] being a boy. She later successfully expelled the soul of [[Levia barisol]] from her body through the birth of [[Nemesis Sudou]], conceived through an [[incest]]uous encounter with Gallerian. She would then place [[Irina Clockworker]] by placing her into the [[Clockworker's Doll]], convincing Gallerian (and [[Houtei no Nushi|the doll herself]]) that she was his daughter [[Michelle Marlon|Michelle]]. She was only able to expel [[Eve Moonlit]] at the end of the world with the birth of [[Eve (master of the heavenly yard)|]] from the [[black box (evillious nendaiki)|]] inside the Clockworker's Doll.[/spoiler]

She is one of the singers in [[Chaban Capriccio (vocaloid)|]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: clockworker's_doll
body:
The Vessel of the Sloth in the [[Evillious Nendaiki]] universe.

A clockwork doll created by [[Irina Clockworker]] as [[I.R. (venomania-kou no kyouki)|]] during the events of [[Venomania Kou no Kyouki (vocaloid)|]] that resembles [[Eve Moonlit]], the Original Sinner. Eventually acquires a new consciousness and awakens as [[Houtei no Nushi]].

[spoiler]It was designed to contain the demon of sloth [[Eve Moonlit]] after Irina recognized it as residing inside [[Mikulia Greeonio]]. Once the demon moved into the doll, it would use its hypnosis several times to impersonate the identity of several woman, including [[Mikulia Calgaround]], [[Platonic (akujiki musume conchita)|]], and [[Margarita Blankenheim]].

During the Duel of Merrigod Plateau, Eve's soul fused with Irina Clockworker's and [[Levia barisol]]'s to create [[Ma (evillious nendaiki)|]], leaving the doll empty. After [[Michelle Marlon]]'s death, Ma took advantage of the situation to expel Irina's soul into the doll and convince [[Gallerian Marlon]] that the soul belongs to Michelle, leading [[Houtei no Nushi|her to believe she is as well]].

As a result of a series of body swaps during [[master of the heavenly yard (vocaloid)|]], [[Nemesis Sudou]]/[[Levia barisol]] ends up inside the doll.[/spoiler]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]
other_names: クロックワーカーズ・ドール

title: levia_barisol
body:
A recurring character of the [[Evillious Nendaiki]]. She is the "twin sister" of [[Behemo barisol]], and is one of the protagonists of [[Barisol no Kodomo wa Hitorikko (vocaloid)|]]. [spoiler]Behemo's original avatar in the Second Period.[/spoiler]

One of the four pillar gods and the reason for the appearance of most of the [[Kagamine Rin|Rin]] characters through the series. She was supposed to be the overseer of the Hellish Yard until a certain incident.

A brilliant scientist, she researched about the heart, the mind and soul of humans in an attempt to stop the spread of the "[i]Malice[/i]" and avoid the destruction of her world.

[spoiler]After the events of [[Kiseki no Yukue (vocaloid)|]], she is reincarnated (alongside a dormant Behemo) into the body of [[Elluka Chirclatia]], taking on the identity of [[Elluka Clockworker]]. She later becomes one of the three souls fused together to create [[Ma (evillious nendaiki)|]] alongside [[Irina Clockworker]] and [[Eve Moonlit]], before being expelled by reincarnating into [[Nemesis Sudou]].[/spoiler]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]
other_names: レヴィア=バリーゾール

title: kokutan-douji
body:
A character from [[Enbizaka no Shitateya (vocaloid)|]] featured in [[Nozarashi no Kubi Onigashima nite (vocaloid)|Nozarashi no Kubi, Onigashima nite]]. He is portrayed by [[Kagamine Len]] and is a reference to Momotarou.

A boy born from a black-wooded tree who went on a journey to find his true mother after being instructed to do so by a [[mermaid]]. He is accompanied by [[Saruteito]] and [[Inukichi (enbizaka no shitateya)|]] on his travels, eventually arriving in Enbizaka and boarding with [[Sudou Kayo]] while trying to determine the culprit behind a series of recent murders. Once Sudou Kayo is revealed to be said culprit, he is the one who ends up executing her via [[decapitation]].

[spoiler]A reincarnation of [[Allen Avadonia]], who was sent to Jakoku by [[Behemo barisol]] in an attempt for him to meet [[Riliane Lucifen d'Autriche]]'s reincarnation [[Miroku Rin]]. The two failed to meet because Rin left town when Kokutan was in Enbizaka and was murdered shortly after her return.

After utilizing [[Grim the End]] in a [[katana]] form to execute Kayo, he returned to the Heavenly Yard alongside Behemo and [[Octo Kagura]].[/spoiler]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: tsukimoto_bufuko
body:
A [[maid]] serving the Octo family in Jakoku, who tended to [[Sudou Kayo]] while recovering from her burns from the Great Fire of Enbizaka. The delusional Kayo would mistake her for her deceased son, [[Sudou Ren]], due to both having [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]].

[spoiler]The identity used by [[Behemo barisol]] while in Jakoku under orders to retrieve [[Kokutan-douji]].[/spoiler]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: sex_doll
body:
A type of sex toy. Usually a doll that mimics the overall shape and sexual functions of a human being. Some types are inflatable while others contain limited locomotion functions.

h4. See Also:

* [[artificial vagina with body]] - for an incomplete sex doll, often just a lower body functioning as an [[artificial vagina]]
* [[realdoll]] - a sex doll that were built as a duplicate of an actual person/character

title: breeding_mount
body:
A device used to collect [[cum|semen]] from [[horse]]s by encouraging them to “mount” it. Essentially a  “heavy duty [[artificial vagina|onahole]]”.

Given the propensity for [[futanari]] characters to have a very [[large penis]], breeding mounts are a popular subject for works involving them. In such cases, handles are added to the side to assist them in thrusting.

title: anal_only
body: A situation where a character either has restricted use of their vagina (such as [[maebari]], [[backless panties]], [[chastity belt]], etc.); or where a character voices or shows their displeasure for vaginal sex and/or their preference for anal sex (by [[speech bubble]], [[body writing]], etc.). Can also be used in [[public use]] situations where text depicts that only anal sex should be performed.

title: drawcia_soul
body:
The second and true(?) undead form of [[Drawcia]], fought at the very end of [[Kirby Canvas Curse]]. Here, she is significantly more monstrous, being a giant orb with five [[yellow eyes]] and fighting [[Kirby]] through rather unorthodox methods compared to his previous foes.

Intentionally or not, she kicked off the trend of final bosses gaining a "Soul" form, among which are [[Marx Soul]], [[Magolor Soul]], [[Soul Of Sectonia]], [[star_dream|Star Dream Soul OS]], [[Void Soul]] (and possibly [[void_(kirby)| Void]]), and [[Chaos Elfilis]].

title: the_rain_woman
body:
A painting created in 1996 by Ukrainian artist Svetlana Telets. It features the portrait of a woman standing in the rain, who has distorted and elongated features, dresses all in black, and wears a large, wide-brimmed hat. It is known for its dubious creation process and being allegedly “haunted”.

The painting inspired a trend on Xiaohongshu to cosplay as the titular woman, giving it recognition in China.

title: flat_color
body:
When an image is colored in solid blocks of color, without shadows, highlights, or gradients. The image is "flat" in that there are little to no indications of depth.

h4. Examples

* !post #7254847
* !post #6796270


h4. See also

* [[high contrast]]
* [[partially colored]]
* [[ligne claire]] (An art style that utilizes flat colors)
* [[limited palette]]
* [[no lineart]]
* [[blending]] (A possible result of flat colors)
* [[Tag group:Image composition]]
* [[Tag group:Colors]]

h4. External links

* "Comic Book Glossary: Flat Color Comics":https://comicbookglossary.wordpress.com/flat-color-comics/

title: friedrich_der_grosse_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the German battleship [i]Friedrich der Große[/i], as part of a collaboration with [i][[World of Warships]][/i]. Character design by [[Enka (bcat)]], voiced by [[Nabatame Hitomi]]. 

She is portrayed as a [[mature female|mature woman]] with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] [[hair over one eye|covering her right eye]], [[red horns|red]] [[mechanical horns]], [[yellow eyes]], and [[large breasts]]; who fancies herself an orchestra conductor. She sees the Commander and others as children, gently chiding them and being generally caring, unlike [[Roon (azur lane)|]]. 

Her default outfit consists of a [[double-breasted]] [[black dress]], [[detached sleeves]], [[red gloves]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of two animalistic hull pieces with all four of her 406 mm twin gun mounts. 

h4. Skins

* !post #3480690: Default
* !post #3975261: [[friedrich der grosse (zeremonie of the cradle) (azur lane)|Zeremonie of The Cradle]]
* !post #3779142: [[friedrich der grosse (dark raiments of gagaku) (azur lane)|Dark Raiments of Gagaku]]
* !post #8052266: [[friedrich der grosse (one summer night's intimacy) (azur lane)|One Summer Night's Intimacy]]

h4. History

The H-class proposals were a series of battleship designs meant to succeed [[Bismarck (azur lane)|]] and significantly improve the [i]Kriegsmarine's[/i] fighting capacity against the Royal Navy and [i]Marine Nationale[/i]. Wartime materials shortages and the infrequent operations of [i]Kriegsmarine[/i] following the sinking of [i]Bismarck[/i] prevented further development of the designs.
The ships were also left unnamed, with [[Ulrich von Hutten (Azur Lane)|]] being the closest to an actual name as attested by documented unofficial talks in the German Naval High Command. 

h4. Alternative verisions

* !post #7648887: [[little friedrich (azur lane)|Little Friedrich]]

h4. See also
* [[Ulrich von Hutten (Azur Lane)|]], the only one of the H-39s that ever received some gesture of naming.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: H-class":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/H-class_battleship_proposals]
other_names: フリードリヒ・デア・グローセ(アズールレーン)

title: albert_heinrich
body: One of the protagonists of the series [[Cyborg 009]], the silver-haired Albert and his wife Hilda were shot while trying to flee Communist East Germany. The would-be escapee was transformed by the Black Ghost organization into Cyborg 004, a walking arsenal. His legs conceal [[rocket launcher|rocket launchers]], his right hand has a [[machine gun]] in each finger, and his left is razor-edged.

title: satonaka_chie
body:
A [[Persona 4]] character.

An upbeat girl with [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] who usually wears a [[green jacket|green]] [[track jacket|athletic jacket]] decorated with buttons. Her weapon is a pair of greaves. She has an obsession with Kung fu, and even uses them in battle, similar to Lisa Silverman of Persona 2. Most of the time, she is friendly, cheerful, and energetic, but she has a short temper, especially with Yousuke. Chie, Yukiko, and Rise are unskilled at cooking, often providing the main cast with unpalatable to terribly awful dishes through the course of the story. Yousuke refers to their horrible cooking as "Mystery Food X."

Her Persona is [[Tomoe (Persona 4)|]] of The Chariot Arcanum, a muscular female figure wearing a yellow outfit reminiscent of Bruce Lee's famous tracksuit, wielding a double bladed naginata. Tomoe is shown to use both physical and low-level ice spells. Tomoe evolves into [[Suzuka Gongen]] after maxing out her Social Link, the one for The Chariot Arcana.

She is also one of the female characters whom the protagonist can have a romantic relationship with.

Voiced by: [[Horie Yui]] (Japanese), Tracey Rooney (English, PS2 release), [[Erin Fitzgerald]] (English, [[Persona 4 The Golden|Golden]] onward).

h4. Appearance
* !post #397704: Default
* !post #1936623: [[Persona 4: Dancing All Night]]

title: vegetative_state
body:
A physical and mental state where the patient is completely catatonic, lacking any movement or reaction to the environment. It is caused by either severe head trauma, an extended lack of oxygen to the brain, or a very serious mental disease.

* "Wikipedia: Vegetative state":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vegetative_state]

title: ophelia_phamrsolone
body:
Character from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. A member of what used to be Team A, a group of extraordinary magi destined to save the world, she now serves as one of the Crypters. Ophelia is the Crypter of the second Lostbelt, Götterdämmerung, and her Servant is the classical Norse hero [[Sigurd (fate)|Sigurd]], a Saber. Furthermore, she is in love with [[Kirschtaria Wodime]], the leader of Team A.

[spoiler]Ophelia possesses a [[Mystic Eyes|Mystic Eye]], which she keeps concealed underneath an [[eyepatch]]. In the story of LB2, Ophelia constantly attempts to befriend Mash, having felt uncomfortable as one of only two girls in Team A amidst a group of men. Her desire to be Mash's friend ultimately holds her back in her mission.[/spoiler]

Ophelia has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[sidelocks]] and [[blue eyes]], [spoiler]although her Mystic Eye is revealed to be [[red eyes|red]], giving her [[heterochromia]][/spoiler].

title: konpaku_youmu
body:
The "Half-Human Half-Phantom". Stage 5 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Perfect Cherry Blossom]] and later a recurring playable character.

Gardener of [[Hakugyokurou]], the netherworld pagoda, and bodyguard of its "princess", [[Saigyouji Yuyuko]]. She wields a [[katana]], Roukanken, and a [[wakizashi]], Hakurouken. Youmu specializes in rapid swordplay taught by her predecessor [[Konpaku Youki|Youki]]. She is always followed by [[Konpaku Youmu (ghost)|her phantom half]], which floats beside her. She is nicknamed "Myon" in many fanworks, based on a [[myon (phrase)|nonsensical word]] she muttered back in PCB. Ironically, although she is half-phantom, she is terrified of ghosts.

h4. Example

* !post #8296178: Usual Appearance

h4. Related Pools

* Pool #9288:  Touhou - Youmu's Cool Swords
* Pool #11184:  Touhou - Youmu the Half-Ghost Gardener
* Pool #12079:  Touhou - Youmu the Phasmophobic Half-Ghost

h4. See also

* [[Konpaku Youmu (Ghost)]]
* [[Shimamura Youmu (unadare)|]]
* [[Myon (phrase)]]

title: mystic_eyes_of_death_perception
body:
A type of [[Mystic Eyes]] from [[Tsukihime]] and [[Melty Blood]] that are considered to be such a rarity that they are thought not to exist at all. Under the Noble Colors System, they are designated as Rainbow, the highest level, and are considered Divine Spirit class Mystic Eyes. The eye granted the user an ability to see the "Lines of Death" on a living being, and allowed them to "cut" it to instantly kill anyone.

They are possessed by [[Ryougi Shiki]] and [[Tohno Shiki]]. Also [[Michael Roa Valdamjong]] in the body of [[Tohno Shiki (2)]] displays a similar ability.

h4. Examples
* !post #1512285: Mystic Eye of Death in use
* !post #7048424: Lines of Death, first-person view

h4. External links
* "Type-Moon Wiki: Mystic Eyes of Death Perception":https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Mystic_Eyes_of_Death_Perception

title: pack_noodles
body:
A ready-to-eat food composed of instant [[noodles]], typically [[instant ramen|ramen]] noodles, sold with [[packet]]s that have flavoring powder, seasoning oil, etc., contained in a plastic pack, or bag for larger noodles or for housing multiple smaller packs. Most require no cooking, so you just add to a bowl, add hot water, and cover and wait for three minutes before eating, but others may require stovetop cooking for three minutes.

Because the noodles are already cooked, the [[instant noodle block]] can be eaten directly from the pack to comedic results.

h4. See also

* [[cup ramen]]
* [[instant ramen]]
* [[instant udon]]
* [[instant soba]]

title: captain_vanilla
body:
A Gal Monster from [[Alicesoft]]'s fantasy settings, first appearing in [[Toushin Toshi II]]. They most prominently appear in [[Galzoo Island]], where one Captain Vanilla is a main character.

As their name might imply, they resemble petite girls dressed like [[pirate]]s, and tend to have stubborn, volatile personalities. These traits have earned them a reputation amongst other Gal Monsters as a barbarous, violent race.

title: hebi-san
body:
A Gal Monster in [[Alicesoft]]'s fantasy settings, appearing in the [[Rance (series)|]] and [[Toushin Toshi]] series beginning with [[Rance I]], though their most prominent appearance is in [[GALZOO Island]]. They resemble young women with [[long hair|long]], [[purple hair]] and are typically [[completely nude]], though some members wear clothing, and are always accompanied by a green [[snake]].

The Dark Lord [[Medusa (Rance)|]] from the Rance Series is a notable member of this species.

title: bb_(fate/extra_ccc_fox_tail)
body:
Originally [[BB_(fate)|]]'s first character design as EXTRA's boss, which got scrapped and appeared in the Fate/EXTRA material book (asset #23869591). It was later repurposed for [[Fate/EXTRA CCC Fox Tail]]'s "BB1st".

[Spoiler]BB1st isn't actually BB, but Meltryllis disguised as her after becoming Kazuradrop's puppet.

title: selene_(pokemon)
body:
Selene (Japanese: Mizuki) is the protagonist female Trainer from Alola in [[Pokemon SM]] and [[Pokemon USUM]]. See [[Elio (pokemon)|]] for the male protagonist.

She is never directly named in the core games. Selene is the most commonly used name used for this character, including in promotional materials for [i]Sun and Moon[/i] and in [[Pokemon Masters EX]]. Promotional materials also refer to her as Moon, and promotional materials for [i]Ultra Sun and Ultra Moon[/i] refer to her as Ailey (Japanese: Koumi). 

Her [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is [b]Moon[/b].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #22756569: [[Pokemon SM]]
* !asset #22756561: [[Pokemon USUM]]

h4. External links

* "Bulbapedia: Moon (Adventures)":[https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Moon_(Adventures)]

title: elio_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Elio[/b], known as [b]You[/b] (ヨウ) in Japan, is the male player character in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon sm|Sun and Moon]][/i].

This Trainer loves Pokémon and adventure. He continues to train in the Alola island challenge, and his skills have even gained him recognition from Professor Kukui [tn](official bio)[/tn]. 

He has [[grey eyes]] and [[medium hair|shoulder-length]] [[black hair]] with [[swept bangs]]. He wears a [[black hat|black]] [[baseball cap]], a [[blue shirt|blue]] [[striped shirt|striped]] [[t-shirt]], a [[bracelet]] called a [[Z-Ring]], [[grey pants|grey]] [[capri pants]], [[blue footwear|blue]] [[shoes]], and carries a [[black bag|black]] [[backpack]] (post #2379816).

His [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is [b]Sun[/b].

title: serena_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Serena[/b] is the female player character in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon xy|X and Y]][/i].

This Trainer from Kalos loves Pokémon and fashion. She's usually cheerful and upbeat, but when a battle starts, her demeanor shifts, revealing her calm, serious side [tn](official bio)[/tn]. 

She has [[grey eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]]. She wears a [[pink headwear|pink]] [[hat]] [[eyewear on headwear|with]] [[white-framed eyewear|white-framed]] [[sunglasses]], a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[sleeveless shirt]], a [[mega ring]], a [[red skirt|red]] [[high-waist skirt]], [[thighhighs]], [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]], and a [[pink bag|pink]] [[handbag]].

Her [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is [b]Yvonne Gabena[/b] or Y.

title: calem_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Calem[/b], known as [b]Calme[/b] (カルム) in Japan, is the male player character in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon xy|X and Y]][/i].

A stoic Trainer in pursuit of strength, he conceals his burning desire to grow stronger and plays it cool outwardly [tn](official bio)[/tn]. 

He has [[grey eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]]. He wears [[black-framed eyewear|black-framed]] [[sunglasses]] [[eyewear on headwear|on]] a [[red headwear|red]] [[hat]], a [[blue jacket|blue]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] [[turtleneck jacket]], a [[mega ring]], [[skinny jeans]], [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]], and carries a [[black bag|black]] [[messenger bag]].

His [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is [b]X[/b].

title: nate_(pokemon)
body:
The male protagonist of [[pokemon_bw2|Pokemon Black 2 & White 2]].

Known as [b]Kyouhei[/b] in Japanese versions. His female counterpart is [[Rosa (pokemon)|]]. Their Japanese names come from kyoumei (共鳴), meaning "resonance".  In English, this association is also kept, with "resonate" turning into "Rosa" and "Nate".

His [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is [b]Blake[/b] (ラクツ [i]Lack-Two[/i] in Japanese).

h4. External links

* "Bulbapedia: Blake (Adventures)":[https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Blake_(Adventures)]

title: hilda_(pokemon)
body:
The protagonist female trainer from Unova (Gen V) in [[Pokemon BW]]. Known as [b]Touko[/b] in Japanese versions. Her male counterpart is [[Hilbert (pokemon)|]]. 

Supposedly older than the previous main game protagonists. She is friends with [[Cheren_(pokemon)|]] and [[Bianca (pokemon)|]]. If the player chooses Hilda, then Hilbert joins the player in the Multi Battle trains in the Battle Subway.

She has [[blue eyes]], [[long hair|long]] [[curly hair|curly]] [[brown hair]] worn in a [[high ponytail]] with [[sidelocks]], and a [[baseball cap]]. She wears a [[black vest]] over a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[white shirt]]/[[tank top]], [[wristband|wristbands]], [[short shorts|short]] [[cutoffs|cutoff]] [[denim shorts]] with [[exposed pocket|exposed pockets]], brown [[boots]], and usually carries a pink [[shoulder bag]].

Her [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is [b]White[/b].

h4. Official Art
* !post #2480020: Default

h4. See also

* [[Hilbert (pokemon)|]]

h4. External links

* "Bulbapedia: White (Adventures)":[https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/White_(Adventures)]

title: priest_(dq3)
body:
A character class in [[Dragon Quest III]]. The original Japanese name is 僧侶 (Souryo), which literally translates to Priest. Named Pilgrim in the NES western localization due to [[Nintendo]]'s strict policy against religious terms and imagery and Cleric in the Game Boy Color western localization. The Priest outfit consists of an orange [[bodysuit]] covered by a blue [[tabard]], yellow [[boots]] and [[gloves]], and a tall blue [[mitre]], with the mitre and tabard each being marked with a [[cross]]. The female priest has [[long_hair|long]], [[blue hair]] and [[red eyes]].

h4. See also

* Dragon Quest Wiki: http://dragon-quest.org/wiki/Priest
* wikia: http://dragonquest.wikia.com/wiki/Priest

title: hilbert_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Hilbert[/b], known as [b]Touya[/b] (トウヤ) in Japan, is the male player character in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon bw|Black and White]][/i].

This highly talented Trainer is said to have acquired his Pokémon battling skills on a journey around Unova. He seems calm but actually hates losing.

He has [[brown eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]]. He wears a [[red headwear|red]] [[poke ball print]] [[hat]], a [[black shirt|black]] [[t-shirt]] under a [[long sleeves|long sleeve]] [[blue jacket]], a [[black belt]] with a silver metal [[belt buckle|buckle]], [[grey pants]], [[red footwear|red]] [[shoes]], and carries a [[messenger bag]].

His [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is [b]Black[/b].

title: lucas_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Lucas[/b], known as [b]Kouki[/b] (コウキ) in Japan, is the male player character in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon dppt|Diamond and Pearl]][/i].

This Trainer is from Sandgem Town in the Sinnoh region. With a kind soul and strong sense of justice, he’s also an assistant to Professor Rowan, the authority on Pokémon Evolution [tn](official bio)[/tn].

He has [[grey eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]]. He wears an [[orange headwear|orange]] [[poke ball print|print]] [[beret]], an [[orange scarf]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[short sleeves|short-sleeve]] [[shirt]], a [[black vest]], a [[bracelet]], a [[poketch|Pokétch]], [[grey pants|grey]] [[baggy pants]], and [[orange footwear|orange]] [[two-tone footwear|and]] [[grey footwear|grey]] [[shoes]].

His [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is [b]Diamond[/b] who often looks [[sleepy]] and eats [[food]].

title: zahra_(been)
body:
Original character by [[rourou (been)]].

Zahra is a 17-year-old girl with [[red eyes]], [[long hair]] [[red hair]] and [[huge breasts]].  She was from a slum and she stole for herself and the orphans she cares for. She is good at dancing, but she is afraid of being caught as a prostitute, so she only dances secretly. Due to being chosen by the gods, the temple caught her as a tribute. 

* !post #7191937: Basic appearance

h4. External Links

* "Pixiv #117890552":[https://www.pixiv.net/artworks/117890552]: Zahra's original background story is in the 4th image.

body:

Other names: [b]Crys[/b], [b]Chris[/b], [b]Crystal[/b].

h4. Variations

* {{kris_(pokemon) pokemon_gsc}}
** Her original appearance, as the female playable character in [i][[pokemon_gsc|Pokémon Crystal]][/i].

** In the [i]HGSS chapter[/i], she wears [[Lyra (pokemon)|]]'s clothes:
*** {{kris_(pokemon) lyra_(pokemon)_(cosplay)}}

title: aila_paivikki_linnamaa
body:
Character from [[Luminous Witches]].

A Pilot Officer from Suomus, she retired after an injury and became a singer at London. Very close friends with [[Eleonore Giovanna Gassion]].

Her familiar is an Arctic wolf named [[Finn (luminous witches)|]], and she's based on Aarre Päiviö Linnamaa, a pilot rather than a singer like the rest of the cast.

body:
The protagonist in [i]Yellow[/i] arc (volumes 4 to 7) of the manga [[Pokemon Adventures]]. She has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] that she keeps in a [[ponytail]]. She wears a [[black shirt]] and [[pants]] underneath a [[yellow tunic]] held fast with a [[belt]]. She looks [[reverse trap|boyish]] if she hides her ponytail in a [[straw hat]], which she uses to disguise her gender.

title: shadowmama_(fallenshadow)
body:
[[Fallenshadow]]'s [[real life insert|real]] mother. First appeared on stream during her subathon, after a goal was reached for a "live interview":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5gSfPHemIfk&pp] on September 11th 2022.

She is a giraffe, with [[giraffe ears]], [[giraffe horns|horns]] and [[giraffe tail|tail]]. She has [[green eyes|green eyes]] and a [[very long hair|very long]] [[hime cut]] [[blonde hair]] with a [[side ponytail]]. She wears a green [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] [[turtleneck]] [[sweater dress]] with a [[heart cutout|heart shaped]] [[cleavage cutout]] and a [[high belt|waist high]] [[loose belt]].

The design is made by [[Fallenshadow]] herself.

title: ethan_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Ethan[/b], known as [b]Hibiki[/b] (ヒビキ) in Japan, is the male player character in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon gsc|Gold and Silver]][/i].

A reliable veteran Pokémon Trainer from Johto, this energetic nature lover can often be found roaming the mountains [tn](official bio)[/tn]. 

He has [[grey eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]]. In his [[pokemon hgss|HGSS]] outfit, he wears a [[backwards hat|backwards-]][[baseball cap|cap]], a [[black shirt]] under a [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] [[red jacket|jacket]] with a [[zipper pull tab|zip tab]], a [[pokegear|Pokégear]], [[black pants|black]] [[capri pants]], [[red footwear|red]] [[sneakers]], and carries a [[grey bag|grey]] [[backpack]].

His [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is [b]Gold[/b] who has [[yellow eyes|gold eyes]] and often carries a billiard [[cue stick]].

title: miori_celesta
body:
[[Indie virtual YouTuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber]]. Designed by [[Ozzingo]].

Originally debuted as part of [[MyHolo TV]]'s second generation, she graduated on March 21, 2021 alongside the rest of her generation. She joined [[Tsunderia]] as a "DLC character" to the [[Tsunderia quest|first generation]] on May 3, 2021, until she graduated from the group on April 23, 2022. She has been an indie VTuber ever since. 

She is portrayed with [[brown hair]], [[green eyes]] with [[star in eye|stars]], and [[medium breasts|medium]] to [[large breasts]], and is always shown wearing a [[musical note hair ornament|treble clef hair ornament]].

h4. Costumes

h5. Regular costumes

title: aircraft_intakes
body:
Aircraft using piston engines use intake systems similar to automobiles.

With the development of jet engines and the subsequent ability of aircraft to travel at supersonic speeds, it was necessary to design inlets to provide the flow required by the engine over a wide operating envelope and to provide air with a high-pressure recovery and low distortion. These designs became more complex as aircraft speeds increased to Mach 3.0 and Mach 3.2, design points for the XB-70 and SR-71 respectively. The inlet is part of the fuselage or part of the nacelle.

Aircraft with a maximum speed greater than about Mach 2 use intakes with variable geometry to achieve good pressure recovery from take-off to maximum speed.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Intake":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intake]
* "Wikipedia: Aircraft intakes":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Components_of_jet_engines#Air_intakes]

title: intake
body:
An intake (also inlet) is an opening, structure or system through which a fluid is admitted to a space or machine as a consequence of a pressure differential between the outside and the inside. The pressure difference may be generated on the inside by a mechanism, or on the outside by ram pressure or hydrostatic pressure. Flow rate through the intake depends on pressure difference, fluid properties, and intake geometry.
h4. Types of intake
* [[aircraft intakes]]
* [[automobile engine intakes]]
h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Intake":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intake]

title: jato
body: JATO (acronym for jet-assisted take-off) is a type of assisted take-off for helping overloaded aircraft into the air by providing additional thrust in the form of small rockets. The term JATO is used interchangeably with the (more specific) term RATO, for rocket-assisted take-off (or, in RAF parlance, RATOG, for rocket-assisted take-off gear).

Variants based on it depict various characters using her pose and cadence to tell off the [[fourth wall]], or occasionally a different character in a [[2koma]], for assuming something about a third party that is out-of-character for that third party.

title: marcille_donato
body:
Main character of [[Dungeon Meshi]] and one of the original members of [[laios touden|Laios]]' party. She is an [[elf|elven]] mage who wields a tall wooden [[staff]] that forms a loop at the top, called [[Ambrosia (dungeon meshi)|]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[green eyes]], and wears a [[blue robe]] with matching [[blue hood|blue]] [[hooded capelet|hooded]] [[blue capelet|capelet]]. She [i]hates[/i] eating monsters, which (given the manga she's stuck in) is a source of constant frustration/reaction images, and has led to a good amount of memes and emotes.

body: Diego Dionisio Luna Alexander (born 29 December 1979) is a [[mexico|Mexican]] actor, director, and producer, best known for his portrayal of [[Cassian Andor]] in [[Rogue One: A Star Wars Story]] and the Disney+ series Andor, for which he was nominated for a Golden Globe Award for Best Actor - Television Series Drama.

title: sylvie_cariello
body:
Character from [[Luminous Witches]].

A Sergeant from Romagna, she is in fact the princess Silvana Adelaide di Carignano, but she's unpleased of being treated as such and wants to be commended on her own merits. She was transferred to the [[Aviation Magic Band]] to avoid consequences from her getting injured in combat.

Her familiar is a sheep named [[Pekorus (luminous witches)|]], and she's based on Italian singer Silvana La Rosa.
other_names: シルヴィ・カリエッロ

title: joanna_elizabeth_stafford
body:
Character from [[Luminous Witches]]. Nicknamed "Jo".

A boyish girl from Liberion who used to serve in the Navy. She comes from a large family with eight younger brothers, and as a result she's a good cook, and ocasionally refers to herself using "ore". Her height and personality compliment those of [[Sylvie Cariello]].

Her familiar is a prairie dog named [[Smile (luminous witches)|]], and she's based on American singer Jo Stafford.
other_names: ジョアンナ・エリザベス・スタッフォード

title: maria_magdalena_dietrich
body:
Character from [[Luminous Witches]].

A Flight Sergeant from Karsland who received her rank after saving a man implied to be Erwin Rommel in Africa. She's in charge of designing the choreography of the [[Aviation Magic Band]], but she's insecure of herself, and has trouble getting up in the morning.

Her familiar is a flying squirrel named [[Flocke (luminous witches)|]], and she's based on German-American actress Marlene Dietrich.
other_names: マリア・マグダレーネ・ディートリヒ

title: lyudmila_andreyevna_ruslanova
body:
Character from [[Luminous Witches]]. Nicknamed "Milasha".

A Sergeant from Orussia, she came to London to see her idol [[Aila Paivikki Linnamaa]], and ended up joining the [[Aviation Magic Band]] with her.

Her familiar is a Borzoi dog named [[Olivier (luminous witches)|]], and she's based on Russian folk singer Lidia Ruslanova.
other_names: リュドミラ・アンドレエヴナ・ルスラノヴァ

title: eleonore_giovanna_gassion
body:
Character from [[Luminous Witches]]. Nicknamed "Elly".

A former nurse, and close friend with [[Aila Paivikki Linnamaa]].

Her familiar is a house cat named [[Rio (luminous witches)|]], and she's based on French singer Édith Giovanna Gassion.
other_names: エレオノール・ジョヴァンナ・ガション

title: shibuya_inori
body:
Character from [[Luminous Witches]]. Nicknamed "Inorin".

A shy girl from Fuso who came to London to visit her father, before becoming close friends with [[Virginia Robertson]] and joining the [[Aviation Magic Band]].

Her familiar is a calico cat named [[Okoge (luminous witches)|]], and she's based on Japanese ryūkōka singer Awaya Noriko.

title: virginia_robertson
body:
Character from [[Luminous Witches]]. Nicknamed "Ginny".

She's a witch from the Brittanian countryside who found a familiar named [[Moffy (luminous witches)|]] (a bird of some sorts, [spoilers]revealed later to be a swan chick[/spoilers]), and went to London to find its home. She was inducted into the [[Aviation Magic Band]] as a Sergeant due to her singing talent. She's a [[hirschgeweih_antennas|Night Witch]], but for some reason she can only receive radio waves, not broadcast them.

She's based on Scottish folk singer Jeannie Robertson.

title: touma_(ranma_1/2)
body:
Prince Tōma is the young ruler of Togenkyo Island. Because the island is situated on top of a spring which makes it impossible for the island's inhabitants to give birth to females, the only way for his people to find brides is to kidnap them from neighboring islands, assisted by his three human-animal hybrid henchmen, Sarutoru, Torristan, and Wonton.

Tōma's fighting style revolves around the use of illusions created by his sword, but he is a highly capable fighter even without using any. He is fast enough to dodge the Chestnuts Roasting Over an Open Fire Fist and is near equal to [[saotome ranma|Ranma]] in speed and basic combat techniques.

title: ranma_1/2_kessen_tougenkyou!_hanayome_wo_torimodose!
body: [[Ranma 1/2]] movie from 1992, when poetry-spouting swordsman Tatewaki Kuno invites [[saotome ranma|Ranma]] and the others for a jaunt on his new luxury yacht, the last thing the group expects is a sudden storm to shipwreck them all on a deserted island. However, fixing the boat to get home soon becomes the least of their worries, as all the young girls in the group begin to disappear. They have been bride-napped by [[touma (ranma 1/2)|Prince Toma]], the youthful ruler of a floating island, Togenkyo. Because of a magical spring which turns anything it touches instantly male, would-be bridegrooms kidnap girls.
other_names: 決戦桃幻郷!花嫁を奪りもどせ!!

title: strappy_heels
body:
Any of a variety of [[high_heels|high-heeled shoes]], [[sandals]], [[wedge heels|wedges]], [[platform footwear|platforms]], or other pieces of heeled footwear that have one or more [[ankle strap]]s, ties, wraps, or [[ribbon]]s securing the ankle (and calf, sometimes) to the shoe. 

In order to qualify, these:
* [i]Must[/i] be high-heeled footwear of one type or another
* Must have the elevated heel portion visible in the image (unless the footwear is such a uniquely identifiable item that is already known to be high-heeled)

Not to be confused with [[anklet]]s or a (non-high-heeled) pair of [[mary janes]].

title: gabthley
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]RX-110 Gabthley[/b]

An insectoid looking, high-spec transformable [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] [[mobile_suit|MS]] developed with the help of [[Paptimus Scirocco]]. With powerful mega particle cannons in its shoulders and deadly feet claws thanks to its movable frame, the type had fantastic performance at all ranges. 

Two units were supplied to [[Jerid Messa]] and [[Mouar Pharaoh]], who displayed both its amazing power and impractical cost.

[spoiler]Despite the high specs, the Gabthley proved to be nowhere near a match for the [[zeta_gundam_(mobile_suit)|Zeta Gundam]] and its powerful Newtype pilot, [[Kamille Bidan]], who heavily damages Jerid's unit and destroys Mouar's, killing her.[/spoiler]

title: rapture_queen_(nikke)
body:
The presumed controlling intelligence behind the [[Rapture (nikke)|]] invasion in [[Goddess of Victory: NIKKE]].

The 2nd anniversary event "Old Tales" revealed [spoilers]her to be a large humanoid from the waist up, with her lower half seemingly built into the structure of a space station. Numerous cables trail behind her, some of which connect to the back of her head. She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]]. Her primary weapon is a powerful red energy beam she can manifest from multiple parts of her body, and she appeared impervious to attack from [[Cinderella (nikke)|]], probably the most powerful NIKKE in existence at the time.[/spoilers]

[spoilers]A symbol consisting of three black, four-pointed stars appears on her forehead, and the designation "O-001" (or possibly "Q-001") is written on her upper chest.[/spoilers]

title: v.iv_rusty
body:

There is no in-game characterization of Rusty, so all fan art of him is up to individual artist's imagination, and sometimes Rusty is [[mechanization|mechanized]] using Steel Haze/Ortus parts.

title: moran_(nikke)
body:
A playable character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. 

She's part of the [[Underworld Queen (nikke)|]] squad together with [[Sakura (Nikke)|]] and [[Rosanna (Nikke)|]], an anti-crime unit that oversees areas of the Outer Rim and the Ark. She is the leader of the Peony Association, also known as the Templars. Due to her stubborness and airheaded attitude, she is often picked upon by her fellow squad mates.

She has [[red eyes]] and [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[colored inner hair|inner colored]] [[red hair]] with [[sidelocks]] and an [[ahoge]]. She wears a [[two-tone dress|two-tone]] [[yellow dress|yellow]] and [[black dress|black]] [[china dress]] with [[floral print]] and [[chinese knot]], which exposes her [[cleavage]] and [[large breasts]], on top of it she also wears a [[black coat]]. She wears [[tassel earrings]], and usually carries [[round eyewear|round]] [[sunglasses]] [[eyewear hang|hanging]] from her dress cleavage.

h4. Official Art
* !post #7126083: Default

title: havaianas
body: Brazilian brand that manufactures [[sandals]], widely known by its [[flip-flops]] estasblished in 1962.

title: la_chancla
body:
La [b]chancla[/b] o [b]chancleta[/b] is a Latin American word for [[flip-flops|flip-flop]]. 

It may be also known by the names [b]ojotas[/b] (some places in Latin America), [b]chinela[/b], [b]chinelo[/b], [b][[havaianas]][/b] (all in Brazil) or [b]tsinela[/b] (in Philippines).

Widespreadly used by Latino, Brazilian and Filipino mothers to discipline their misbehaving children by hitting them with its sole, both by hand and as a projectile.

title: banica_conchita
body:
Character from the [i][[Evillious Nendaiki]][/i] and the representative of the Gluttony. Represented by [[MEIKO (vocaloid)|]]. Her given song is [[Akujiki Musume Conchita (vocaloid)|]].

A duchess from Beelzenia who once was a recognized gourmet until her taste devolved into eating the most gruesome dishes. Now her only goal is to taste and devour everything in existence.

[spoilers]After devouring herself along with the Demon of Gluttony, she absorbed its powers and became a demon herself. Eventually she awakened as the [[Hakaba no Aruji]].[/spoilers]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: vanity_table
body:
An article of furniture, otherwise known as a dressing table. Designs vary considerably but generally appear as a table with built-in drawers and an attached [[mirror]]. There may be an accompanying [[stool]] as well.

As a vanity mirror may be used in lieu of a bathroom mirror for [[applying makeup|putting on makeup]] or [[hairdressing|styling one's hair]], there might be various [[cosmetics]], [[jewelry]], [[hair ornament|hair ornaments]], and other accessories scattered about on top.

h4.See also

* [[chest of drawers]]

title: chest_of_drawers
body:
Also called a dresser, it's a piece of furniture that has [[drawer]]s for storing clothes. May sometimes have a [[mirror]].

For dressing table, see [[vanity table]].

title: cosmetics
body:
Cosmetics are products or objects used to apply [[makeup]].

See [[makeup]] for makeup worn on the face. Cosmetics is for the makeup products themselves.

h4. Related tags

h6. Products & containers

* [[compact (cosmetics)|]]
* [[contact lens|contact lenses]]
* [[lipstick tube]]
* [[shampoo]]
* [[soap]]
* [[lotion]]
* [[nail polish bottle]]
* [[perfume (cosmetics)]]
* [[makeup palette]]

h6. Treatments

* [[hairdressing]]
* [[applying manicure]]
* [[applying pedicure]]

h6. Misc objects

* [[eyelash curler]]
* [[mascara wand]]
* [[makeup brush]]
* [[nail clippers]]
* [[razor]]
* [[tweezers]]
* [[vanity table]]

title: makeup_palette
body:
A small box that contains a collection of [[makeup]] products in different colors - most commonly [[eyeshadow]] and blush.

h4. See also

* [[cosmetics]]
other_names: アイシャドウパレット

title: chainsaw
body:
A portable mechanical, motorized [[saw]]. It is used to fell [[tree]]s and remove [[branch]]es and foliage. It's frequently seen as a weapon in horror films, often inflicting extremely bloody wounds and severing limbs.

A few characters use this as their weapon of choice, namely [[Leatherface]], [[Haruna (korezom)|]], [[Blaze (Arknights)]], [[Juliet Starling]] and [[Denji (Chainsaw Man)|]].

h4. See also

* [[tools]]
* [[chainsword]]

title: onmyoji
body:
A mobile and desktop game about [[onmyouji]] ([i]yinyangshi[/i]) created by NetEase. The game was released on February 23, 2017 in China and later worldwide.

It is a turn-based fantasy strategy game with PVP or PVE battles, where you can strengthen your beloved shikigami to build your dream tactical team and defeat various demons to become the ultimate onmyoji. 

Has a duel card game spinoff called [[Onmyoji: The Card Game]] and a MOBA game spinoff called [[Onmyoji Arena]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Onmyoji Characters]] 

h4. External links
* "Official Twitter/X (EN)":[https://x.com/Onmyojigame]
* "Official Twitter/X (JP)":[https://x.com/OnmyojigameJP]
* "Onmyoji Wiki":http://onmyoji.fandom.com

title: miori_celesta_(comfy)
body:
[[Miori Celesta]]'s 5th costume, referred to as her "3.0" or "comfy" costume. Used for a time as her main appearance, until her [[Miori Celesta (guildmaster)|current default]] was released.

The costume consists of a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]] worn under a [[white hoodie]], [[asymmetrical legwear|mismatched legwear]] ([[single thighhigh]] on left, single [[socks|sock]] on right), white [[shoes]], [[black shorts]], and a [[white sports bra]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #6221453: Reference sheet

title: miori_celesta_(old_design)
body:
[[Miori Celesta]]'s original default costume as she debuted in [[MyHolo TV]], referred to as her "1.0" or "adventurer" costume. Retired with the release of her [[Miori Celesta (guildmaster)|current default costume]].

This costume consists of a [[pink capelet]] worn over a [[pink shirt|pink]] [[halter shirt]] with a [[cleavage cutout]] and a set of [[detached sleeves]], [[shirt tucked in|tucked into]] a [[brown skirt|brown]] [[high-waist skirt]] and a pair of [[white footwear|white]] [[boots]] with [[black thighhighs]] and [[garter straps]]. Underneath she wears a set of [[white panties]] and [[white bloomers|bloomers]]. In this look, she has [[very long hair]] that is [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[colored inner hair|on the inside]], and is adorned with a [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]].

Later on, in March 2022, she received a variation on this costume, referred to as her "1.5" or "barmaid" costume. In this costume, the capelet is dropped, her detached sleeves are replaced with a pair of [[short sleeves|much shorter ones]], and she receives a [[pink bow]] on her neck, a set of [[wrist cuffs]], and an [[apron]] with a pin of [[Mogu (miori celesta)|]]. In this look, she has [[long hair]] tied in a ponytail with a [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]], with variable bangs to extend her [[hair over one eye|hair past one eye]] and [[one eye covered|cover]] it. 

This 1.5 update also added the option for her to switch her eye color to [[pink eyes|pink]] or [[blue eyes|blue]], a feature that was originally introduced in her [[miori celesta (casual)|2nd costume]], and retroactively added through this update.

h4. Appearance

* !post #8150049: 1.0 Reference sheet (1)
* !post #5158311: 1.0 Reference sheet (2)
* !post #6304901: 1.5 Reference sheet

title: miori_celesta_(guildmaster)
body:
[[Miori Celesta]]'s 6th and current default costume, referred to as her "4.0" or "guildmaster" costume. It replaced her [[Miori Celesta (old Design)|first costume]] after releasing in September 2024.

This costume consists of a [[short dress|short]], [[frilled dress|frilly]], [[white dress|white]] [[sleeveless dress]] with a belt [[halterneck|halter]] that becomes partially [[see-through dress|see-through]] toward the bottom, has a [[cross-laced cutout|cross-laced]] [[cleavage cutout]], and short [[detached sleeves]]. As the guildmaster, she wears a brown and a red [[overskirt|overskirts]] with [[side slit|side slits]] and a [[loose belt]] with [[potion]] bottles hanging from it. She may also wear a [[hooded cape]] or a tavernmaid [[apron]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #8371356: Reference sheet

title: miori_celesta_(chibi)
body:
[[Miori Celesta]]'s 4th costume, exclusively used for her official [[chibi]] model, illustrated by [[Joo Gumoon]].

This costume consists of a [[yellow dress]] and a [[white apron|white]] [[apron]] with a pair of [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]] and [[white socks]].

In this look, Miori's hair is worn in [[long hair|long]] [[twin braids]], adorned with [[pink bow|pink]] [[hair bow]]s.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6304952: Reference sheet

title: miori_celesta_(casual)
body:
[[Miori Celesta]]'s 2nd costume that released as she joined [[Tsunderia]], referred to as her "2.0" or "casual" costume.

This outfit consists of a [[white sweater|white]] [[off-shoulder sweater]], worn over a [[black shirt|black]] [[halter shirt]] and tucked into a [[brown skirt]]. She also wears a [[green jacket]] over the rest of her outfit, a pair of [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]] with [[black thighhighs]], and a [[white headwear|white]] [[beret]]. Her accessories include a pair of [[pom pom earrings]], a [[green bow|green]] [[hair bow]], and optional [[glasses]].

In this look, Miori has [[short hair]] with [[hair intakes|intakes]], and the option to change her eye color between [[green eyes|green]], [[pink eyes|pink]] (considered the default for this costume), and [[blue eyes|blue]]. This outfit also has a [[kemonomimi mode]] option, which adds a pair of [[cat ears]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #6304973: Reference sheet

title: mudrock_(rubble)_(arknights)
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Mudrock (Arknights)|]] of [[Arknights]].

title: unfinished
body:
An incomplete work, including cases such as [[sketch]]es, [[lineart]], or [[flat color]] illustrations posted before the final image, or scrapped works that the artist decided not to complete. Posts that show various steps in the creation process should be tagged with [[making-of]] instead.

Images that appear complete may still apply for this tag if the artist commentary/tags denotes it as being incomplete.

h4. See also

* [[production art]]

title: out-of-frame_censoring
body:
Used when any piece of nudity is just out of view off the edge of the image. Oftentimes including the [[groin|mound of Venus]] with the genitals out of the frame, or similarly a breast with a nipple out of frame.

If you can see a bit of the genitals, then [[pussy_peek]] or [[penis_peek]] would apply as well

h4. See Also

* [[convenient censoring]]
* [[fake scrollbar]]
* [[implied sex]]
* [[Tag Group:Image Composition]]

title: gordon_freeman
body:
The silent protagonist in most games in the [[Half-Life (series)|]] series. He first appeared in the [[Half-Life 1]] [[video game]] from 1998.

Iconic features include his [[glasses]], his [[beard]], his [[HEV suit]] and his [[crowbar]].

body:

title: astra_militarum
body:
The Astra Militarum (also known as the Imperial Guard) are a tabletop army for [[Warhammer 40K]], one of the primary factions within the Imperium of Man.

The Imperial Guard is characterized by being regular human soldiers in an apocalyptic future hellscape. The Guard is made up of countless different regiments, each with their own appearance, tactics and equipment. Many Guard regiments are based on or modeled after a particular historical army. Always well known for fielding massive numbers of troops, in recent years the Imperial Guard has also become known for their large variety of [[tank]]s.

h4. See also

* [[Adeptus Astartes]]
* [[Commissar]]
* [[Death Korps of Krieg]]
* [[Catachan Jungle Fighter]]
other_names: アストラ・ミリタルム

title: bridge_(nautical)
body: A bridge (also known as a command deck), or wheelhouse (also known as a pilothouse), is a room or platform of a ship, submarine, airship, or spaceship from which the ship can be commanded. When a ship is under way, the bridge is manned by an officer of the watch aided usually by an able seaman acting as a lookout. During critical maneuvers the captain will be on the bridge, often supported by an officer of the watch, an able seaman on the wheel and sometimes a pilot, if required.

title: gnome
body:
A fictional creature created by Paracelsus as the earth elemental.  They are typically said to be a small, humanoid creature (resembling a tiny old man) that lives underground and hordes treasure, and are commonly drawn wearing a pointed hat.  A statue of one used as a lawn ornament is known as a [[garden gnome]].

Due to living underground, they are often used as an earth elemental in fantasy works, particularly in Japanese video games.  They are also a common fantasy player character race, due to [[Dungeons & Dragons]] where they are a bit larger than in most traditional depictions and are often pranksters, illusionists, and/or tinkerers.

h6. Specific gnomes

* [[Gnome (Mon-Musu Quest!)]]

* [[Gnome (Seiken Densetsu)]]

title: shroud_of_martin
body:
Holy Shroud given to [[Emiya Shirou]] by [[Kotomine Kirei]] during [[Heaven's Feel|Fate/stay night: Heaven's Feel]]. He wears it as [[bandages]] wrapped around his left arm, [spoiler]which has been replaced with [[Archer (fate)|]]'s after he was attacked by the [[shadow (fate/stay night)|]][/spoiler]. A similar red [[igote]] is featured in the design for [[Senji Muramasa (fate)|]] in [[Fate/Grand Order]], but this hasn't been confirmed to be the same shroud.

Not to be confused with the [[Shroud of Magdalene]].

title: cleanup_fellatio
body:
A type of afterplay in which someone uses fellatio actions (licking, sucking, etc) to clean semen or other sexual fluids off (or out) of their partner's penis. It can also be used to prepare a penis that has already ejaculated for another round. 

If someone is performing fellatio on a penis that has already ejaculated, it's this.
